settings.title: Drolet Wood Stove Models
settings.subheading:
Keeping cozy on frosty winter nights is as simple as tossing in a log and watching it crackle and flame in any Drolet high-efficiency wood stove.

Drolet wood stoves come in all shapes and sizes, with both traditional looks for that extra-cozy feeling and modern models for a sleek, simple aesthetic.

And don’t worry about size or heating capacity — there’s a perfect Drolet stove for every home.
settings.override_product_description_1: The Drolet Escape 1800 heats up to 2,100 square feet and produces 75,000 BTUs/h — that’s nothing to sneeze at.
settings.override_product_description_2: Say goodbye to cold winter nights — the Drolet Heat Commander Wood Furnace puts out an astounding 310,000 BTUs/h.
settings.override_product_description_3: With an automatic blower system and cast iron door, it’s hard to find a wood stove as high quality as the Drolet HT-3000.

settings.title: Drolet Pellet Stoves
settings.subheading:
Want the comfort of a wood stove without the hassle of keeping it fed several times a day? Then you’re looking for a Drolet pellet stove.

Drolet pellet stoves can last close to 70 hours without having to have their pellets replaced, and with the self-feeding system, you’re looking at almost 140 hours of hassle-free heat.
settings.override_product_description_1: Reliable and affordable, Drolet ECO-55 Pellet Stove won’t disappoint, and with its incredible storage tank with a pneumatic self-feeding pellet system add-on, you can enjoy that cozy heat without lifting a finger.

settings.title: Drolet Wood Stoves Inserts
settings.subheading:
Drolet wood stove inserts transform your inefficient fireplace into the toastiest corner of your home. A great secondary source of heat, a Drolet wood stove insert lets you toss aside the blankets and bask in the heat of a traditional stove.

These made-in-Canada products keep the winter winds out and the cheery heat in without putting a burden on your HVAC system.
settings.override_product_description_1: Take your fireplace to the next level with the Drolet Escape 1800-I Wood Insert.
settings.override_product_description_2: Escape those freezing winter nights with the Drolet Escape 1500-I Wood Insert.

settings.title: Drolet Wood Cook Stove
settings.subheading:
Nothing feels quite as rustic as baking bread over the embers in a Drolet wood cookstove. You’ll feel like you’re living in the good old days while still having all the modern amenities of a high-quality, made-in-Canada Drolet stove.

With both cast iron and steel options at incredible prices, Drolet wood cookstoves are just what you need to spark that homey feeling during frosty winter nights.
settings.override_product_description_1: Get that scrumptious wood smoke taste with the Drolet Outback Chef Wood Burning Cookstove.
settings.override_product_description_2: Keep the logs roaring and the tasty dishes coming with the Drolet Bistro Wood Burning Cookstove.

settings.title: Can you cook on Drolet wood stove?
settings.text:
Looking to live that old-school cottage life? Then a Drolet wood stove might be for you. Yes, with some Drolet wood stove models, you can cook to your heart’s content on the cooking surface (or even right on the embers for a taste that can’t be duplicated).

If you’re looking to channel your inner chef, then make sure to check out the Drolet Outback and Drolet Bistro.

settings.title: Who owns Drolet wood stoves?
settings.text:
Founded by Francois-Xavier Drolet in 1960, Drolet wood stoves are made in Canada and owned by Stove Builder International, a family-owned manufacturing firm with deep roots in the frosty north. It’s headquartered in Saint Augustin de Desmaures.

Francois was a mechanical engineer who understood the importance of a high-quality product at a reasonable price. They’re also well-known for their Drolet Street Fountains.

settings.title: Are Drolet wood stoves made in Canada?
settings.text:
Sometimes we get asked, “Are Drolet wood stoves any good?”

The answer is a resounding yes!

Drolet wood stoves are high-efficiency, incredibly affordable wood stoves made in Canada. And boy do our frosty northern neighbors know how to make a high-quality product.

settings.title: How heavy is a Drolet wood stove?
settings.text:
Every Drolet wood stove is different, but in general, Drolet stoves can range from 300 lb to 575 lb (and sometimes even heavier). It all depends on the model.

We recommend professional installation of Drolet wood stoves given their weight.
